main event: On 5 February 1949, a civilian driving near Parkersburg, West Virginia, observed an intense white light followed by a reddish yellow light, which he believed to be an aerial phenomenon.
interesting points: The witness first noticed the intense white light, followed by a reddish yellow light, leading him to see an object descending towards a hill and emitting molten drops from its rear.
The observed incident lasted approximately 15-20 seconds, with no noticeable impact on the weather or surroundings.
The witness was alone in his car during the observation, and there were no other witnesses reported.
He had been driving from Akron to Parkersburg and was tired at the time of the incident.
The witness, a turret lathe operator, had mechanical hobbies and was a stamp collector.
sighted object: intense white light followed by a reddish yellow light and a descending object emitting molten drops
